alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 5:27AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cook County through 600 AM CDT... At 527 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saganaga Lake, or 19 miles northwest of Gunflint Lake, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saganaga Lake around 535 AM CDT. Sea Gull Lake around 540 AM CDT. Gunflint Lake around 555 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include North Lake, Long Island Lake and Gneis Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. This storm may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
